messages.messageBody:
>>Yes, and she's kind enough to visit strangers in the hospital. Well I was
>>KIND of strange.>>

Well actually Sandra, you *were* pretty strange that afternoon after the

Life is good.
~Mary

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Earth Mother Marji
messages.msgSnippet: Shucks, that s awful sweet of you folks!  It was just the stuff I needed to hear after driving a total of an hour and a quarter to drive a little guy home.  He
messages.messageBody:
Shucks, that's awful sweet of you folks! It was just the stuff I needed to
hear after driving a total of an hour and a quarter to drive a little guy
home. He had planned to spend the night with us and then at about 9:30
p.m. or so decided he'd rather go home, which is a half to three quarters
of an hour's drive from our home. I felt sleepy and in a generally funky
mood when I walked back in the door carrying a 50-pound bundle of
still-sweet-smelling sleeping boy. Did you know that kids gain 20 pounds
when they're sleeping? It's amazing but true!

Anyway, thanks, folks, for being there to cheer me up, even when you didn't
know I was in need of cheering. Now *that's* what I call intuition!!

With love and gratitude,

Marji


At 23:17 3/8/03 -0700, you wrote:


> >>***You seem like an earth motherly type, radiating calm and peace :-)***
> >
> >I get that calm and peaceful feeling from just her e-mails. She must be
> >amazing in person!>>
>
>I got to meet Marji in person too. She *is* pretty amazing. :o)
>
>Life is good.
>~Mary



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
